channel.title: [PI] Take away
channel.description: How do I make a object take away everything in your inventory and the items you have on when you click it?

item.title: [PI] Take away
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

mmk. I don’t really care about Rep, but thanks I guess. I wish this person was still online so he could say if we’re helping him at all.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Take away
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:6, topic:398671”][quote author=Marine5287 link=topic=495808.msg3624956#msg3624956 date=1307757761]

if(objectID == #) { deleteItem("####, #"); }

Tell me if that works. Obviously fill in the information needed where the “#” is.
[/quote]
Did you take that from the post I made on a different topic 5 minuets ago?

And that won’t work. He wants it to take away everything that he has, that would just delete a certain ID.

To do it you would have to add a public void to delete all items, then make the object ‘call’, (I think it’s called call), that void.

For example-

public void removeAllItems() { for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { playerItems[i] = 0; } for (int i = 0; i < playerItemsN.length; i++) { playerItemsN[i] = 0; } resetItems(3214); }

if(objectID == ####) { removeAllItems(); }

That’s just for removing inventory items though, not equiped stuff. You’d have to figure that out yourself unless someone else were to spoonfeed you.[/quote]

Yes, thank you for clarifying that. As you can see I gave you credit in the rep++.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Take away
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“Marine5287, post:5, topic:398671”]if(objectID == #) { deleteItem("####, #"); }

Tell me if that works. Obviously fill in the information needed where the “#” is.[/quote]
Did you take that from the post I made on a different topic 5 minuets ago?

And that won’t work. He wants it to take away everything that he has, that would just delete a certain ID.

To do it you would have to add a public void to delete all items, then make the object ‘call’, (I think it’s called call), that void.

For example-

public void removeAllItems() { for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { playerItems[i] = 0; } for (int i = 0; i < playerItemsN.length; i++) { playerItemsN[i] = 0; } resetItems(3214); }

if(objectID == ####) { removeAllItems(); }

That’s just for removing inventory items though, not equiped stuff. You’d have to figure that out yourself unless someone else were to spoonfeed you.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Take away
item.dc:creator: @hawkgames hawkgames
item.description:
@hawkgames wrote:

Well I’m trying to work on a minigame, so I don’t want ::empty, I need it to take away items so players can’t obtain it besides inside the minigame.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Take away
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

Well you can add a ::empty command. To do that, go into PlayerAssisstant.java and search for

and this this above:

public void removeAllItems() { for (int i = 0; i < c.playerItems.length; i++) { c.playerItems[i] = 0; } for (int i = 0; i < c.playerItemsN.length; i++) { c.playerItemsN[i] = 0; } c.getItems().resetItems(3214); }

Now go into commands.java and add

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("empty")) { c.getPA().removeAllItems(); c.sendMessage("You empty your inventory"); }

and save, compile, and it should work.

Read full topic
